title: Proof that the automated system is broken?
body:
Hello League of Legends boards!

The 11th February I get a email saying that I get a chat restriction for 10 games. I was really surprised since I most of the times never say a word, save for a "GGWP" after the game sometimes. So I stop saying even simple things like that most of the time. (Picture of email below) 
http://imgur.com/NVaQCWX

The 20th February I get another email saying that I get another chat restriction for 25 games. (Picture of email below) 
http://imgur.com/Zo2uR9f

Now I was thinking, this is a joke. The amount of real "toxic" people I have played with who report me for no reason is actually getting ME punished?

Yesterday, I play 1 ranked game and after a game (we lost) I get the usual reports (I presume from them /all "report nunu" and the usual *losing the game rage, blame someone quick!*). 
Things that pissed them off: I built AP on support Nunu because our ADC was seriously lacking the ability to deal damage (started with attackspeed on Caitlyn, even though I was bloodboiling him 24/7) and the game was pretty much over anyway. Ended up dealing only ~300 damage less than him in the end...
And here comes the best part, after the game I get this: http://imgur.com/1UKSJSc

I got no new emails, but that is probably because they got NO WORDS at all to paste in the "chat log". Since I dont talk at all after my restrictions.
They say you should login to see the reform card that got you banned (after searching for clues on the internet), but all I get is a error and the above message when trying to play any games (i presume the error is because they have NO words at all to paste in this reform card = error).

Thoughts about this system?

**TL;DR:** You actually can get banned from saying nothing and getting reported by raging kids enough times.
I have never been banned before. And no I have not used hacks or anything like that. The ban is for being "toxic" by saying nothing.

**My Profile:** http://tr.op.gg/summoner/userName=ll%20%20ll%20%20ll%20%20ll
(I cant login on the TR boards for some reason so I try here on this other account)

Which is a wonderful opportunity to say once again that the line in the report form shouldn't be "Feeding" at all.

I said it when the new system was revealed.
I made a thread about it a few weeks ago: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/uZ2OHQul-riot-consider-renaming-intentionally-feeding-to-something-more-generic
Sadly, it didn't get any traction on the boards...

But I'll repeat it here, since you seem to be aware of the problem: there are many more ways to throw a game than to just feed. Why were the old "Assisting enemy team" and "Refusing to communicate" removed? They are both more generic and more useful than the current reasons. You can check my old thread for more details.
We have that generic option, Unsportsmanlike Conduct.

I disagree that "Unsportsmanlike" is a fitting description for the somewhat more serious offenses, even though it's generic.

Being unsportsmanlike is displaying a negative attitude, blaming your teammates in a policed but useless way, bragging when you win, or saying "lagg" when you lose, saying "ez" at the end of a game, etc. This is the kind of general "conduct" that is "not cool" but isn't any specific category of "bad".

Someone that refuses to play or intentionally loses a game is not simply "unsportsmanlike", he is not respecting the basic social contract of LoL at all. And it shouldn't be grouped with the other problems mentioned above.
I would say not respecting that basic social contract is unsportsmanlike and I wouldn't say unsportsmanlike is minor at all. More than that it even specifically lists griefing falls under it.

You are technically correct, given the current system. But my point is precisely that there is an issue with the current system.

I'm asking for something more generic to replace "Intentionally feeding", but it shouldn't be the other extreme with a category like "Unsportsmanlike" covering everything from "gg ez" to "intentionally leaving lane and forcing an open mid on the team". Or we could as well have only one reason called "did bad stuff" and be done with it.

EDIT: and Slumber Jack here himself acknowledges that there is a problem with the reasons to report presented in the form. That's why I decided to repeat myself, despite no success in the previous attempt.

I wish griefing was its own option. It is too important to be a footnote.

It probably is necessary for intentional feeding to be its own specific report because there is automated intentional feeding detection so it needs to look specifically for that.

Riot should reintroduce the tribunal in addition to the automated system for cases like this one.

Just have auto punishment active, but give every person a limited option to appeal. if a person appeals the case is sent to the tribunal where to community can decide whether or not the punishment was deserved or not. if it was deserved the punishment stands and the person loses 1 appeal option (to prevent toxic players to simply always appeal when they get punished and waste everyone's time). If the community doesn't see fit to punish a person the punishment is revoked and the appeal refunded.

If you know you are innocent you have nothing to fear since you wont lose anything and have everything to gain, but if you did some nasty stuff you might not want to waste your appeal(s) on cases you know you lost anyway.
